maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves the workload namespaces in the vCenter Server system.
This cmdlet retrieves the workload namespaces in the vCenter Server system and requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a set of IDs of the workload namespaces. The ID is also equal to the name of the workload namespace.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of filters for the names of the workload namespaces.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of IDs of the workload namespaces. The ID is also equal to the name of the workload namespace.
Specifies a set of filters for the names of the workload namespaces.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all workload namespaces in the vCenter Server system.
Retrieves all workload namespaces that match the filter specified for the Name parameter.
Retrieves the workload namespace with the specified ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves information about workload namespace access permissions.
Retrieves information about workload namespace access permissions.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the workload namespaces whose access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies a filter for the Domain property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies a filter for the PrincipalName property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server(s) on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is specified to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a filter for the Domain property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies the workload namespaces whose access permissions you want to retrieve.
Specifies a filter for the PrincipalName property of the access permissions you want to retrieve.

Specifies the vCenter Server(s) on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is specified to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all the access control permissions for the workload namespace with name "Development".
Retrieves the access control permissions for the "Development" namespace for users or groups from the domain "MyCorpDomain" whose PrincipalName starts with "Alice".

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves the configuration of the storage claimed by a workload namespace.

This cmdlet retrieves the storage configuration claimed by a workload namespace. The storage claim is expressed as a storage policy and parameters of the claim. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a set of WMNamespace objects for which you want to retrieve the configuration.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies a set of WMNamespace objects for which you want to retrieve the configuration.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the configuration of the storage claimed by the namespace called "MyNamespace".
Retrieves the configuration of the storage claimed by all namespaces in the vCenter Server system.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet creates a new workload namespace on the specified cluster.

This cmdlet creates a new workload namespace on the specified cluster. The specified cluster must have workloads feature enabled. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the cluster where the workloads in this namespace will run.
Specifies the description of the workload namespace.
Specifies the name of the workload cluster. The value must be a valid kubernetes identifier.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the cluster where the workloads in this namespace will run.
Specifies the description of the workload namespace.
Specifies the name of the workload cluster. The value must be a valid kubernetes identifier.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a workload namespace called "MyNamespace" on the "MyWMCluster" cluster.

maml:description.maml:para: Grants an access permission to a workload namespace.
Grants an access permission to a workload namespace.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the workload namespace to grant access to.
Specifies the user's domain. For local users - specify "localos".
Specifies the name of the user or group.
Specifies the type of the security principal - either a user or a group.
Specifies the role that you want to grant to the user or group.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the user's domain. For local users - specify "localos".
Specifies the workload namespace to grant access to.
Specifies the name of the user or group.
Specifies the type of the security principal - either a user or a group.
Specifies the role that you want to grant to the user or group.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-WMNamespacePermission Development -Role Edit -Domain localos -PrincipalType User -PrincipalName Alice

dev:remarks.maml:para: Grants the user Alice an 'Edit' access to the Development namespace.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet creates a storage claim for a workload namespace using the specified configuration.

This cmdlet creates a storage claim for a workload namespace using the specified configuration. The storage claim is expressed as a storage policy and parameters of the claim. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the limit on the storage used by workloads running in the specified workload namespace.
Specifies the workload namespace that you want to use the storage.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the storage policy that you want to apply to the storage used by the specified workload namespace.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the limit on the storage used by workloads running in the specified workload namespace.
Specifies the workload namespace that you want to use the storage.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
Specifies the storage policy that you want to apply to the storage used by the specified workload namespace.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ns = Get-WMNamespace "MyNamespace" PS C:\> $sp = Get-SpbmStoragePolicy "MyStoragePolicy" PS C:\> New-WMNamespaceStoragePolicy -Namespace $ns -StoragePolicy $sp

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace". The storage policy "MyStoragePolicy" would be applied to the storage used by workloads running in this workload namespace. There would be no limit on the storage used by those workloads.

Creates a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace". The storage policy "MyStoragePolicy" would be applied to the storage used by workloads running in this workload namespace. There would a limit of 2048 MiB on the storage used by those workloads.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet deletes a workload namespace from the vCenter Server system.
This cmdlet deletes a workload namespace from the vCenter Server system. The cmdlet requires a connection to a vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the workload namespaces that you want to delete.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the workload namespaces that you want to delete.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes a workload namespace called "MyNamespace".
Deletes all workload namespaces that have a name that matches the "Target*" pattern (i.e. begins with "Target").

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an access permission to a workload namespace.
Removes an access permission to a workload namespace.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the access permissions that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the access permissions that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WMNamespacePermission Development -PrincipalName Alice | Remove-WMNamespacePermission

dev:remarks.maml:para: Revokes the access permission of the user Alice to the Development workload namespace.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet deletes the storage claim for a workload namespace associated with a specified storage policy.

This cmdlet deletes the storage claim for a workload namespace associated with a specified storage policy. Pods, that use persistent storage from the earlier version of storage policies, can access them till the datastores are attached to the worker nodes. To get the existing storage claims, see the Get-WMNamespaceStoragePolicy cmdlet. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the storage claims that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the storage claims that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sp = Get-WMNamespaceStoragePolicy -Namespace "MyNamespace" | where { $_.StoragePolicy.Name -eq "MyStoragePolicy" } PS C:\> Remove-WMNamespaceStoragePolicy $sp

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace" associated with the "MyStoragePolicy" storage policy.
Deletes a storage claim for the workload namespace "MyNamespace" associated with the "MyStoragePolicy" storage policy.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a workload namespace.
This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a workload namespace. The cmdlet requires a connection to a vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the set of namespaces on which you want to to apply the change of the configuration.
Specifies the new value of the description for the specified workload namespace.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the new value of the description for the specified workload namespace.
Specifies the set of namespaces on which you want to to apply the change of the configuration.

Specifies the vCenter Server systems on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is given to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-WMNamespace "MyNamespace" -Description "The new description text"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the description of the workload namespace "MyNamespace" to "The new description text".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WMNamespace "Target*" | Set-WMNamespace -Description "The new description text"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the description of all workload namespaces that have a name matching the "Target*" pattern to "The new description text".
Sets the description of the workload namespace "MyNamespace" to be blank.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an access permission to a workload namespace.
Modifies an access permission to a workload namespace.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the access permissions that you want to change.
Specifies the new role that you want to set.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the access permissions that you want to change.
Specifies the new role that you want to set.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WMNamespacePermission * -PrincipalName Alice | Set-WMNamespacePermission -Role View

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the permissions that Alice has on all connected workload namespaces and modifies thier role to 'View'.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a storage claim used by a workload namespace.
This cmdlet modifies the configuration of a storage claim used by a workload namespace. The cmdlet requires a connection to vCenter Server using the Connect-VIServer cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the storage claims whose configuration you want to change.
Specifies the new limit on the storage used by workloads running in the workload namespace using the corresponding storage policy. To remove the limit, specify $null.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies the new limit on the storage used by workloads running in the workload namespace using the corresponding storage policy. To remove the limit, specify $null.
Specifies the storage claims whose configuration you want to change.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Changes the limit on the storage used by the workload namespace "MyNamespace" using the storage policy "MyStoragePolicy" to 1000 MiB.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $allStorageForMyNamespace = Get-WMNamespaceStoragePolicy -Namespace "MyNamespace" PS C:\> Set-WMNamespaceStoragePolicy -NamespaceStoragePolicy $allStorageForMyNamespace -LimitMiB $null

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the limit on the storage used by the workload namespace "MyNamespace" for all the storage policies currently used by this workload namespace.
